description:
Seems like people love or hate this place- I'm in the love crowd.

It's the fastest and most affordable (yet still tasty) lunch in the area. I always order the veggie super burrito or the mushroom and egg burrito with jalapeños. The spicy kick takes it to the next level. Sometimes I'll come for breakfast and get the chilaquiles or huevos rancheros. Their house salsas are great. The back patio area is cute too. Overall everything I've had here is good and service is consistent. The woman who rings you up will always without a doubt greet you with a hola guapa/o which completes the experience.

Cheese enchiladas are also good if you're having a cheat day. Rents in this part of town is pricey which explains their prices-don't blame them. With the other restaurant next door closing I'm afraid this will be next if we don't keep dining here. Keep small businesses alive!
author: Stine H.

description:
When some folks talk nonstop about how "good" a certain eatery is, I can't help but raise an eyebrow. Coming from a person who's guilty of overhyping mediocre restaurants, I know too well the need to have some skepticism. 

Sure, I've come across a lot of places worthy of infinite praise (https://yelp.to/qTKq/gji3wdyUCP). But more often than not, I've found plenty of sour apples as well.

The most recent example comes from Victor's, a VERY popular Mexican eatery in the Mission Bay Area part of San Francisco. Despite a negative review from my girlfriend, I reluctantly stopped by a few days ago since I needed to pick up quick food after a volunteer shift. Long story short, I should've just gotten something outside my office at Focaccia...

Located on 3rd and Townsend Street, Victor's is essentially your standard Mexican food stop. This place served burritos, chimichangas, tacos, nachos, quesadillas, and several plates - all with the usual types of meat such as al pastor and carnitas. The interesting thing about Victor's, however, is that customers have some flexibility in the ingredients that go into each order. Kinda like with Chipotle, you can pick your salsa as well as the type of beans (if any). In terms of cost, I found this place to be pretty average; most items hovered around $8-$10 and for burritos specifically, they charged around an extra dollar for a super (has guac, sour cream, and cheese).

When I stopped by, I picked up a Regular Carnitas Burrito with Black Beans and Spicy Salsa. Boy, I really wish I could get back my $10 because the experience was much different from what a lot of my friends had glamorized. First off, I felt like the ratio of ingredients was pretty unbalanced. They gave me a whole bunch of beans and rice, but very little salsa and pork. Secondly, the burrito felt really bland without any sauce. I would've appreciated getting guac or sour cream without paying extra. And most importantly, the pork carnitas was SO LACKING. Although the outsides were sort of crispy, I hated the fact that they came in such large chunks. I really didn't like that one of the cooks half-heartedly cut up the meat. And the flavor just wasn't all the way there, probably since the pork had been sitting there a while (they don't cook it in front of you). In a nutshell, it was more of a Chipotle experience than anything else. 

Beyond the bleh food, I can only think of two reasons why I'd have the heart to recommend Victor's to other people. The first being that the location was quite convenient. I mean there's literally nothing else nearby my office/Mission Bay except food trucks and chains (e.g. Tender Greens and Taco Hell). Furthermore, the service was quite genuine, amicable, and heartwarming. I loved that they had a bowl of chips and salsa at the counter where you could nibble on while waiting for your food, and they packed some with each order. Plus, the cashier was VERY friendly! She went on and on talking about her wonderful grandchildren. 

Tl;dr Victor's to me is a place I'd go to if I had absolutely no other option in the area. It's not bad per say, but among all the Mexican eateries I've had this ranks pretty low. Meh food, but good service so I'd give it a "Tolerable, sufficient for sustenance" rating.

Eat well and prosper,
author: Bryan W.

description: Food is great! Meat is seasoned perfectly, salsa bomd as hell. And most of all the customer service is amazing I feel at home here. A need to stop and eat location whenever I come to. SF
author: Daniel M.

description: If only there were more seating! Great, fresh food and mama will make you feel right at home. While we decided what to order she had us try mild and spicy salsa and guacamole. We got a shrimp burrito, fish tacos, and chips and guacamole. Would definitely come back here.
author: Erin S.

description:
If you look real hard you can still find a few remnants of old SF. Not the best Mexican food you'll ever eat. But neither is much of the real Mex. food in Mex. Since 1985!

6- Stars for sincerity and friendliness 
6- Stars for quaintness. 
4 - Stars for food 

Keep walking past Taco Bell and get in here!
author: Stephen B.

description:
HOLAAA GUAPA! 

This is my favorite place to come when I'm having a bad day at work! For two reasons: 
1) The woman who runs this place is awesome and will definitely put a smile on your face!
2) The food is amazing and is my ideal type of "comfort food" 

PROS: 
(+) Quick Service 
(+) Great Food (I always get the Shrimp Burrito.. super, with hot sauce)
(+) Even better service 
(+) Larger than average portions

CONS: 
(-) Kind of expensive for a burrito ($10+ with tax) 

Definitely prefer this place over Taco Bell (across the street). Would definitely recommend if you are in the area and craving a burrito!
author: Natalie F.

description: Kinda small and stuff but amazing mouthwatering food!
author: Rumaisa M.

description: Get a super chorizo breakfast burrito, you will not be disappointed. I'm addicted to it at this point; it's a real problem. I come here for the food, the nice back patio, but I stay for the owner yelling at me. She's amazing.
author: Jim L.

description: I was sort of surprised of the service I just got at Victor's because in the past I hadn't ever had a negative experience. So I just went to Victor's and ordered Pozole which was today special and it was advertised at $8.50 on a white board out front. After being handed my order I was told it was $10. I didn't argue nor say anything because after all this is a mom and pop establishment so $1.50 wasn't going to break me. So then I get home getting ready to eat my food but it is cold like it was just given to me out of the refrigerator. Also, where is the tortillas? I know last time I ordered the same thing it had tortillas and it came hot. Very very disappointed!!!!  I work right across the street and go to Victor's often but now I may have to rethink that. What a shame Victor's.
author: Michael H.

description:
Basic Mexican food.  Fast service.  $10.44 for a Chicken 'Super' Burrito.

Nice to have a remnant of the neighborhood remain.

-1 star for the obnoxiously loud greeting upon entry.
author: Tiger S.

description:
Definitely a favorite option near the ballpark. Dirt cheap but excellent food, love the Burritos and Juevos Rancheros.

As many others have pointed out, the owner is EXTREMELY outgoing and personable, you will likely know a great deal about her family and the history of the business by the time you finish ordering.

Be sure to check out the back "patio" dining area, very nice!
author: Mike J.

description:
"Hola Guapo!" Whenever you see the owner, this is how she'll greet you. This is a hole-in-the-wall independently owned restaurant and she's one of the main reason why I always enjoy coming here, as she's very friendly and enjoys talking to her customers.

This restaurant is walking distance from AT&T Park and they're a great alternative to get lunch at before a game or grabbing food to-go when you go to the ballpark. If you're going to be there on a Weekend, they are closed earlier on Saturdays and they are closed all-day on Sundays. 

Their prices have gone up quite a bit over the years, but that's SF for you. I always get their super burrito, which is a decent size and includes their chips. There's very limited seating inside, but plenty of seating outside in the back of their restaurant. Even though it's outdoors, it's completely covered from any wind or rain.

Their food is average and they're decently priced for San Francisco; but I really do enjoy their service & owner. 3 stars for the price & food, but I'll round up for the friendliness and the quality of their service. It always feels good to support the independently owned businesses, especially when the owner and their employees are very friendly to their customers.
author: Johnny W.

description: Authentic mexican food, portions are very descent. Personal favorite: carne asada enchiladas
author: Eugenia C.

description:
Warm greetings aside, the food was only ok, and I'm not sure I would return.  

I stopped by here with 15 minutes to spare before my Caltrain.  Service was really fast and I had plenty of time to board my train.

The salsas are good and the chicken in the burrito was flavorful, but I felt like everything on the menu was just a dollar or two too expensive.  With tax, a burrito comes out to just shy of $10.  

I do appreciate that they take credit cards though!
author: Alison L.

description:
I had a shrimp burrito, flavor was on point.  Definitely a place I'd keep coming back to.
What made it even better, was the service.
The lady that works there made my experience there an awesome one. She greets everyone in an energetic manner and keeps a positive environment.
If you like to support small local businesses, make it a point to come check them out.
author: Mauricio Q.

description: Good as any place in the Mission and much closer to my casa. Good seating in the enclosed patio out back. I had the huevos rancheros, the burritos looked good too.
author: Tony E.

description: Is this the worst restaurant in San Francisco? I ordered "Huevos Rancheros." I'm not sure the guy had made eggs before, no one washed their hands between handling money and food, and after over-frying my eggs the guy stuck my plate in the microwave for two minutes! Everyone hardy spoke English and I had to ask them to bring out my girlfriend's food as well -- for some reason they made one dish "to go" and the other "for here," and then I had to ask them for napkins and forks/knives as well. Completely unbelievable.
author: Andre W.

description: Just like a classic Mission-style taqueria; many choices of meats; burritos; enchiladas, etc.; add sandwiches. I got a burrito with stewed chicken that they typically serve as soup. Nice young gal made it EXACTLY to my specifications. Quite good. I'd go back.
author: Richard M.

description: Favorite Taqueria in town.  The owners is the magic behind this place with her warm Guapo/Guapa greeting.  The staff is also friendly and the food is solid.  Favorite things are the crispy tacos, and their soups(Pasolé  and Chicken Tortilla).
author: Todd H.

description: Victor's is a amazing Hispanic Resturant!!!! Delicious food, and awesome customer service! The staff are very welcoming and polite. However, they never seem to be ready to serve when the doors open.... easy fix to this problem. Either change the hours of operation to a later opening time or have the opening staff show up early to give themselves time to be ready to serve when the doors open. Punctuality is very important to me, if it wasn't for that minor issue I'd give this place five stars!!
author: Edward R.

description:
"Hola Guapa!!"-  I love Victors! This is a true SF staple. The same woman has owned this place for years. 

The food is consistently good, the service is wonderful and they are very efficient, even during the lunch rush. The prices are VERY reasonable compared to other dining in the area, I say that knowing what rent prices are like on this side of the city. 

I can always count on a great burrito from Victor's
author: Lauren S.

description: Came here on the hottest Saturday but still appreciated the food.  We had super burritos but probably could have shared one burrito.  Family owned operation!  The woman who appears to be the owner talked us into taking the hot salsa and she was right.  More of a light burn hot sauce.  I like how they put tortilla chips into the burrito bags as a freebie.  This place is now a definite stop on the way to AT&T Park.
author: Glenn L.

description: I love coming to Victor's before a Giants game.  Food is awesome and employees are always friendly as ever.  Eat in the restaurant or take a burrito with you to the game!
author: Shannon C.

description: Amazing staff who is very welcoming with every visit, and takes car in preparing the made to order food exactly how you want it. Every time.
author: Matt T.

description: Owner is super nice, servers are nice too. Spicy salsa tastes great. They got cute little backyard. Definitely coming back.
author: Saran D.

description:
Aye okay tacos and burritos.  

This place is lacking a salsa bar, which I love in taqueria places - especially the pico de gallo. 

They have seating area.

It's just not the best taqueria spot in this neighborhood.  Good grab for lunch, I guess.
author: Tiffany D.

description: The people here work hard, they greet you in a peculiar way, the food is tasty and not so expensive.
author: Marco C.

description:
WHAT! Why does this place have such bad reviews? I liked it!! They liked Mochi! There's a back patio for seating!! whywhywhy??

Came here for a super burrito (steak) and B for a shrimp super burrito. The homemade salsa was AWESOME SAUCE (literally)..and the burritos were WONDERFUL! This is my go-to spot for burritos in SOMA. Hands down.

Super great service -- they're so incredibly friendly and patient! They came outside when I was staring at the menu through the window just to welcome me in! 

Definitely will be back for their breakfast burritos too!!
author: Jennifer S.

description:
A solid 3 stars...

I will definitely be giving this place another shot. I think they have a lot of potential to be my new Mexican spot in the area. Apparently when I decided to go they had just gotten a large phone order of 16 burritos. On top of that there were already 6 people in line in front of me. That's usually a great sign. Lots of people waiting patiently for their awesome food.

The workers were going back and forth in between filling line orders and that large phone order, so it actually took a really long time for me to finally get served. I ordered the pastor torta. I was excited because it looked huge and it's just what I was craving! I was even more excited when I picked up my bag to go and felt how heavy it was.

Now, I'm no expert but I am almost certain that they gave me carnitas instead of pastor. Boo. They bread was really soggy by the time I got back to work which is only about a block and a half. But don't get me wrong. It was still decent and I ate the hell out of it!

I will be giving this place another try. I am pretty sure I just ordered the wrong thing. I must try the burrito next time!
author: Andy S.

description: For anyone craving a classic grubby taqueria experience, this is definitely your spot. The menu (burritos, chimis, tortas, street tacos etc.) are pretty much standard Mexican- no fusion-y alterations. The staff also is very sweet, and you can tell they want your business. They also have a really cool backyard dining area that's a little quieter on off-peak weekday lunch hours.
author: Deuce B.

description: Ordered for a steak quesadilla, it was eh. Portion was small for $8 and didn't have good salsa, but steak was good.
author: Angela L.

description:
Came here today for lunch and got the super burrito with Chile Verde Chicken. It's not bad at just over $9 after tax. The line moved pretty fast, and I got to see them putting on the cheese and plopping the burrito on the grill for a few seconds too. I'm a little concerned about how sanitary everything is just because there were three ladies back there bumping into each other. Overall the burrito was pretty good. Comes with tortilla chips which are pretty thick and very deep fried, and the salsa is pretty bland. There's not much seating inside but they have an outside area with tables and seats for maybe 25 people or so. Unfortunately, it's like a greenhouse in there because the ceiling is this clear plastic/glass material and there's no ventilation.

Overall I'd probably come again for the burrito, but try to sit inside or take back to work.
author: Willis L.

description:
I don't work around the corner anymore, but I still drop by occasionally for the "HOLA GUAPA!" and the excellent burritos (carnitas with spicy salsa for me, always). Sit on the covered patio out back and watch cheeky little birds swoop down hoping to catch a nacho crumb or two. 

Victor's is deservedly popular with the lunch crowd and you may have to get in a long line, but service is always quick and friendly and the price is right!
author: Vicky W.

description:
Loved this place. My beef/black beans/spicy super burrito was one of the best burritos I have ever had. The owner was extremely friendly, cheerful, expressive, intense enthusiastic and charming. My order was ready in like 2 minutes. Amazing place!
Definitely going to visit Victor's again. And again. And again.
author: Evgenii G.

description: The ladies that work there are Definitely a Good vibe, funny and Genuine!.  I just wanted a Quesadilla and ended up with a full stomach, laughs and the want to return during their lunch and see what other funny antics these ladies have to give and say.  It was delicious enough for me.  Bless them!
author: John H.

description:
I eat at Victor's for lunch about once a week.  They are one block from my office.  The food is about what you would expect from a walk up - stand in line - made to order Mexican joint.  The prices are okay .. expect to spend about $12 on lunch.  You will get full, 

The nice part, and what keeps me coming back is the theme of the place, set by the owner.  I enjoy walking in and she always shouts :HHHOOOOLLAAA GUUAAAPPOO" ... to every person who enters.  Its a signature of the place.  It makes everyone smile and its really cool.   

Go to Victor's.  :)
author: Paul R.

description:
Amazing Burritos. I Eat here at least 2 a week. Super Secret back porch is very warm and welcoming even on the coldest of days.
My recomendation:
Chicken Verde Super Burrtio 
Half Mild Half Spicy
Black Beans
author: Mason D.

description: Victor's is awesome. The same woman has owned this place for 30 years and she loves her customers. The food is great and consistently tastey.
author: Sarah P.

description: Great stuff!  the people are nice, the super burrito is good, and it's a fantastic value.  Will be back for sure.
author: Matt P.

description:
HOLA GUAPO! 

Gracie is a sweetheart, great food , reasonable prices for the area ( it's expensive in Mission Bay and SMB's have to survive too) 

Def favorite lunch spot near my office.
author: Marcus K.

description:
Bogged down with a cold, I was walking back from getting a haircut today and saw a sign in front of a small Mexican joint that said "Special: Adobo Soup". Thinking it might help me feel better I went inside. 

After receiving a very friendly greeting, I ordered the soup, which came with fresh sliced avocado, diced jalapenos (on request), a lime wedge, some tortilla chips and some fresh corn tortillas. I sat down a proceeded to enjoy THEE BEST Adobo Soup EVER! It was like a Mexican version of Matzah Ball soup, with 3-4 large spiced balls of chicken and chiles in chicken stock, with fresh vegetables and rice. Perfectly flavored, hearty and spicy. I finished every morsel and drop. It also made me feel a lot better, probably because the jalapenos raised my temp by 30 degrees. 

I haven't had anything else at Victor's, and as long as they're serving that soup, I may not have anything else, but one thing's for sure...I'LL BE BACK SOON!
author: Andrew F.

description:
Absolutely loved this place! The women in the front were not only welcoming, but funny as well! There's a beautiful seating area in the back where it's serene! The service was a 5, the food was a 5, everything was a 5. I'd even go back for the "¡Hola Guapa!" whether or not I was hungry.... I'd probably still eat there if I wasn't. 

If you're feeling Latin food, you can't go wrong with Victor's!
author: Menat E.

description:
"Holaaa guapo, what would you like?"
Aw shucks, are you talking to me?

But leave it to yelp to make me realize she calls everyone guapo/guapa (handsome/pretty). I see they even have a sign with that greeting now. 

Having said that, I don't want the rest of this to come across as the words of a jilted lover. So first off as other reviews have pointed out about occasional cash register shenaningans, I also noticed interesting rounding time to time. Which is fine I guess, since I just alter the tip jar contribution by the same so it works out. What's not fine is that this attitude of shortcuts makes me worry if they take shortcuts in the cooking:
-Beef and chicken burritos are okay, if not dry and a little salty
-Tortas, bit boring, especially in the context of a city full of good ones
-Soups, I'd go for it on colder months only
author: Erik L.

description:
Every Friday my entire company goes to lunch together. This las Friday we decided to go to Victor's. We were greeted as soon as we walked in the door with a friendly "HOLA!" The line was pretty long, but it moved pretty quickly. I had a really hard time decided what I wanted to eat, everything that was being made looked and smelled amazing. I was leaning toward a torta, but was hesitant based on the experience I had at Tres two weeks before with their horrible torta...

In the end I decided that I wanted to give Victor's torta a try. I ordered the carnitas torta, it came with a heaping pile of carnitas, lettuce, tomato, cheese, and avocado. It was probably like 3million times better than the Tres torta, the meat was tender and flavorful, and the bread was soft and freshly baked. I will be back to Victor's to try some of their other menu options.
author: Stephanie T.

description:
Being from Los Angeles, I have not many San Francisco burritos, but the chorizo & egg burrito here for Breakfast was terrific and made fresh. Ordered it with everything, so it included rice, sour cream and guacamole. Choice of black beans or refried - I chose refried. Very tasty. The chorizo was hot but not too hot.

It has a patio but Sat morning it was not necessary to be there. Good place to stop when you are near the Cal Train Station.
author: Alan K.

description:
Don't let the loud HOLA Mamma/Papa cries when you enter fool you, turns out that is misleading. The food is sub-par and the only thing this shrewd business woman cares about is your Pesos.  


Here my experience: 

1st visit: Ordered Super Burrito - Instead of being able to watch it made, I was called to the register to pay, by the time that was done, my burrito was too and sadly when I got to my desk, a disappointed, small, run of the mill burrito revealed itself. 



2nd visit: Ordered same thing.  I didn't leave the assembly line and watched my SBurrito made, since this is my favorite Mexican food meal, I have had Burritos from many different places. The chicken in red sauce I ordered must be a favorite because she had to sift thru the sauce to find pieces. When it was not a lot, I asked the server to ad a little. Moving down, towards the cream etc..  I asked for some lettuce sprinkled inside my burrito (in all fairness, its not listed on the menu as included, nor as an extra ingredient) and when the owner, got my burrito, she actually remarked nice and loud.. "Thats a BIG burrito, YOU can have TWO lunches, better SHARE that with someone" Not once, but twice!! Seriously? trying to make me feel bad for getting, what a regular Super Burrito should look like? I have to admit, she got to me and I walked away feeling pretty bad about my food.



3rd visit: This time, I figured, everyone deserves a 2nd chance. I will simply seek the owner out to talk to her. I got in line and curiously observed three gentlemen's, super burrito's assembly. Much to my surprise, theirs was nice and loaded with goodies. (The way it really should be), none of them had to ask to have some more ingredients added). This made me wonder, is this because I am a woman? 

Then its my turn and instead of getting the same treatment, I get the opposite. Near half the amount of rice and refried beans to start with and it continued from there on. I made a small remark about making mine the same as the gentleman before me, but then gave up since the server looked at me confused and irritated. On to the register, here is my chance... 

I figured I talk to the owner and the last visit's remark will turn out to be just a big misunderstanding, perhaps an apology, other explanation.. and if not, at least to have her let me talk and listen?
Boy was I wrong! Here she is raises her voice. (and my burrito) "THIS is a BIG Burrito" holding it up like a trophy and facing the crowd behind me. Then she continues on with her rant, not letting me even get a word in and ends with. "I feel sorry for you", "We dont need customers like you" ,"bye, bye". Oh the theatrics! 


Overall, this somewhat dingy hole in the wall hosts a very dominant, proud, rude and loud owner peddling her overpriced, small Super Burritos.
author: Beatrix F.

description: Stopped here for a breakfast burrito around 10am on a Sat. and will definitely go back for more! The ingredients tasted fresh and quality made. The salsa was spicy and had great flavor. This place is a little run down looking, but it was part of the experience. The kitchen looked clean and the food tasted great - and that's what mattered most. It was nice sitting outside on the covered patio in the back as well. As a heads up, the only drinks they have are bottled and refrigerated drinks including some beer, water, and juices.
author: Sirena F.

description:
Even if this place lacks in the looks and ambiance department, it scores high in character. Every time I walk through the door, I'm greeted with an enthusiastic "¡Hola papi!" or "¡Hola guapo!" It's the little touches like this that will keep me coming back for more.

The only thing I've tried here so far are the burritos with chicken chile verde. They've got their hooks into me with the chicken chile verde, that's definitely something I haven't encountered on a taqueria menu before. 

One word of caution, if you're a bit of a spice wuss like me, be careful with the salsas they have out on the tables. One comes in a squeezy bottle and the other is in a jar. Both of these make me break into a sweat and my glasses start to fog up! 

The food is decent, the people behind the counter crack me up, and everything is crazy spicy. I'm glad my company just moved into a new space down the street, because even the best taquerias downtown weren't as good as this.  Now off to my post-lunch burrito coma....
author: Nate R.

description:
I'm a big fan of anything with nopales.

That's cactus for you gringos : - D 

Yes, I'm a guera, but I know my espanol, gracias ; - )

I'm also a fan of cheap, good food.

Thus, I'm a fan of Victor's.

I came here with a group of male developers, all who were hungry. They began ordering burritos, tacos, and large portions, oh my!

My eye landed on the cheapest thing on the menu: Quesadilla with Nopales.

Si, senor!

It's definitely not the best Mexican food, but it's the best for a low price. Got it? If you want something a bit more flavorful, but pricier, head over to Mexico au Parc (http://www.yelp.com/biz/mexico-au-parc-san-francisco#hrid:IzpX7Bm7eOW2AWCAIC3C9g)

This is simply prepared food, yes, but when you add cheese + salsa (mild and hot) + guacamole + nopales, it equals a tasty, decent-sized meal.

Take it to go and enjoy!
author: Diana V.

description: Love this place! Affordable, delicious mexican food which is hard to come by in this part of San Francisco!
author: Sydney T.

description:
Hola guapo.

Judging from the sign on the counter this is a greeting they give everyone. Still a nice touch. Felt the same way towards my delicious torta.

So much broiled chili green chicken (bit spicy), black beans, lettuce, tomato and avocado inside always outstanding bolillo bread. $7.50 also includes cheese.

Could have been two meals. Late hour and a growing hunger made it one.

Do go say hello.
author: Jason B.

description:
I haven't yet been completely disappointed by the food here. It's your run of the mill local taqueria with salsa that's a little on the hot side.

The locals around here know the biggest draw at Victor's is the persona of the lady behind the register who greets everyone who walks in with a loud, "Hola Guapo(a)!"  She has a very warm motherly feel to her, she can multitask like no ones business too and she makes you feel very welcome...

...that is until another visit. She was in a rush multitasking between myself and two other customers when she asked me something quickly about the San Francisco Giants baseball team. 

"Wah wlah wah waaah SF Giants?", is all I heard. To my ears it registered like Charlie Brown's school teacher talking amongst all the commotion going on around us. So I politely leaned in and asked her, "I'm sorry, what?". And then she made this dejected face while resuming to pack my take out while saying, "El Stupido", towards the bag. 

Well I completely understood THAT. I'm sorry that she takes great offense when people can't understand her. Perhaps phonetic articulation with a louder inflection is in order? I'm honestly very disappointed in her to have experienced that and my lunch buddies and I have since crossed this lunch option off our list.
author: Terry C.

description: Lady greeted me as I walked in, AND al pastor burrito was delish! What else can you ask for?
author: Brian M.

description:
Sorry Victors, YOU'VE BEEN CHOPPED.  Super chicken mole burrito.   Team take-out lunch... drumroll... no mole sauce in the mole burrito.  Doh!   You just can't win without all the basket ingredients.

The rest of the burrito was OK, but the texture of the chicken made me wonder about its provenance.  None of the good burrito purveyors in La Mision need worry.

The salsa was smokey with a little heat.  Nice.... there's a star!

Not in any hurry to try again.  If I have to, will I have a better chance getting all the ingredients if I just order a cheese quesadilla?
author: Bob K.

description:
I love this place.  My coworkers and I have been coming here at least once a week for 5 years.  By the second year they had our orders memorized.  Even if the line is out the door, stay in line.  It is worth the wait, and they move thru the orders very quickly.

I think I have only ordered the Carnitas Super Burrito since day one.  But, when I find a good thing, I stick with it.  I order mine with no rice, but they fill it up with extra beans and meat, so it never feels skimpy.  It is a full meal, and a lot of work to finish it off, but I am always up to the task.

Also, being called Guapa once a week never hurt anyone's ego.
author: Rayne K.

description:
Is this the only Mexican option in SoMa?
If so, someone come please and help these people out. 

In my touring of SF one burrito at a time...I have to say....ehhhhhh?

Maybe there's something I'm missing. Am I supposed to be more enchanted at being called Mami? I can walk down the street in the 'hood I grew up in back in NYC and have that.

Too much sour cream. Too little spice. Beans too watery. Shrimp way overcooked. 

Honey if this was from a cart on a street corner, maybe. But, inside? I need something a little bit better.  I feel mean saying this but Taco Bell has more flavor.

And the service was sllllloowwwwwwwwwwwwww. But, I think the girl who served me that day might have been new. 

Maybe I caught a bad day. Or maybe this business thrives on being one of the only options in the area. You decide.
author: Liss T.

description: The food is great and the owner is really friendly and funny greeting everyone with a Hola Mamma. Great place
author: Mark M.

description: Little shop a block or so from the famed AT&T Ballpark in beautiful downtown San Francisco. Had lunch here in the afternoon and traffic was hectic, which made our meal even more special. I enjoyed the pozole and had two servings, look forward to having the same item every time I visit this area. Very friendly family run business and reasonable prices! Would definitely return again and bring more family with me!
author: J L.

description:
The owner. That's what this place is all about. Go just for the experience of her shouting at you and calling you "guapo"! 

Generally a pretty trafficed spot, but for good reason. Quality meats and tasty specials almost every day.
author: Milan T.

description: Tuesday special of tortilla soup is the best. They sell out so go before lunch. I was feeling under the weather and went to get something warm, spicy and delicious. This soup really hit the soup with its homemade everything. See you there on a Tuesday!
author: Katelyn C.

description:
I'm a local in SOMA.  I stumbled in here on a Saturday morning around 10:30am.  I was welcomed by a friendly worker at the restaurant with, "Hola Guapo!"  This means, "hello handsome" in Spanish.  What better way to be greeted?  It definitely made me smile, as this is how they greet everyone who steps foot in their restaurant.

I ordered the Chorizo Breakfast burrito.  It had all of the main ingredients as normal breakfast burritos do.  One thing that was unique is that they really blended the scrambled egg and chorizo extremely well.  The burrito wasn't too heavy either, which is really good.  The burrito was about $7.50.

I passed by this spot every week and never thought to stop by.  This is one of the great hidden gems in SOMA, especially for Mexican food, which seems scarce here.
author: Andrew H.

description:
Legit Mexican food! 

Vibe and atmosphere does it for me. Super friendly ladies and the owner (presumably) is always energetic. "Papi!" Is the first thing you hear walking in at lunch time.  

Visited many many many times before reviewing. They Never disappoints!
author: Alvin Y.

description:
Staff is very friendly, was greeted right when we stepped into the door.

I ordered a pastor super burrito, and the pastor was surprisingly good. I really was expecting an average, decent, forgettable Mexican restaurant when I came in, but turns out it was actually rather good. Would definitely stop by again sometime in the future for lunch or breakfast.
author: Victor X.

description: Best lunch place in soma. Cheap delicious food that comes quick and with a smile. Line moves very quickly and there is a cool covered patio in the back.
author: Stephen S.

description: Had the burrito and horchata. Everything was average, I've had better. Patio seating was nice =)
author: Teresa C.

description:
Great Customer Service.

Good Food (esp. their tortilla soup) at a reasonable price.
author: Emil D.

description: Went here for lunch today. Good al pastor burrito made to order (I'm really picky about portions of beans, rice, etc.)  The amazing customer service and people is above and beyond. Greeting you when you walk in, which is always nice.  But the kicker was there was a problem with the credit card machine and for those without cash she said to pay next time. That was it, simply "pay next time, okay?" and the customers said okay and she gave them their food.  You'd think they only do this for regulars but she said it to anyone, including my coworker (who is not a regular) and she said "pay next time" before he offered cash.  It's nice to have a local spot with charm.  I hope they don't get screwed by any customers.
author: Tiffany S.

description: Place is cute. The staff is super fun. Burritos are standard, the al pastor was surprisingly decent, I have low expectations for al pastor in SF so one up for victors. Shout out to Chinos in the Richmond district. Gracie, I think, is the lady baggin chips, start a conversation with her, you'll be happy you did. The have a nice patio in the back but it doesn't have ventilation so it can get pretty hot.
author: Elton F.

description: Love victors - las mujeres son muy lindas! Every time I go they make me feel super welcome. Adela y Gracie son fantasticas!
author: Stephen P.

description:
This place was a few steps away from my old place of work, but I only ate there once.

Bland, overly watery Chicken Tortilla Soup with barely any chicken. My friend who SWEARS by their tortilla soup insists it's authentic, which leads me to believe I might just not be a fan of truly authentic chicken tortilla soup. Or generally flavorless soup.

The carne asada burrito was A-OK. You can customize the proportions of the ingredients in your burrito, so I was able to make sure there was very little rice, extra beans, lots of jalapenos, etc. The meat itself was alright.
author: Asha S.

description: Place is pretty tasty! Got the carne asada chimichanga, and would def go back. Service was super friendly. Lady running the place has been there 32 years! Old school San Fran
author: tony b.

description:
If it is one thing we lament staying in Greenvale, it is the deficit of good Mexican.  Often times the local charm of Americana is enough, but far is it from a fine salsa lining a meaty burrito.  Not even Thomas can do one justice, can he Zach? Fond memories of our trips to San Francisco remind us of Victor's - a true hole in the wall that can very easily leave a hole in your wallet if you aren't careful.

Victor's charm lies in its simplicity.  Pick the physical form of your lunch, and fill in the blanks as your configuration passes by all of the possible ingredients on the line.  It isn't much different from a Chipotle or Qdoba, is it Zach?  But as any good agent would know, the devil is in the details.  A spicy, succulent devil.

On our last visit, we chose a burrito adorned with diced beef, pico de gallo, lime and a bit of tomatillo - just enough to cleanse our sinuses as we ate.  The spice factor for both salsas was just right.  The onions dance liberally in the pico de gallo, creating an intriguing twinge.  Why San Francisco can do this so well, and Washington so poorly, is truly a matter worth investigating, right Zach?  But that wasn't all.  The tomatillo proved to be an appropriate delivery agent for the fine beef.  The lime we opted into adding completed the full workup of our taste palette.

Perhaps the enjoyment of this burrito was further enhanced with the friendly demeanor of the food crafters.  The end of our purchase was met with a "thank you, guapo", which may be a cheap pleasantry to give your customer.  But it more than worked and brought on a smile.  Nothing about this was suspect, was it Zach?

Perhaps we should stop daydreaming on the subject and get back to the case.  I'm starting to wonder what those red seeds taste like applied to a hearty queso...
author: Francis M.

description:
Burrito's all day everyday. This place is the bomb. 

As soon as you walk in you're greeted by 'mama' and called either guapo if you're a guy or mamacita if you're a woman. You'll have to place your order quickly.  The ladies their work fast but you won't be disappointed. 

I usually order the SUPER steak burrito with black beans. They also have a great tortilla soup and coke in the bottle! Moderately priced. 

My recommendation: burritos DUH!
author: Heather H.

description:
The food is ok - not bad but nothing special. However...WARNING!!!

WATCH THE CASHIER!!! Every single time, I catch her adding between $0.25 - $0.75 to EVERY SINGLE PATRON'S TAB!! I kid you not.

I told a few co-workers who were going to keep an eye on her. They laughed me off and gave me the, "whatever dude" look. They come back to the office and run over to my desk explaining that they witnessed her add the extra change on to every single person's tab. 

When one buddy confronted her, this was her response, "Mijo - my kids go to private schools and their books are very expensive!" (With a sheepish grin) The guy behind them in line said that he's known about her shenanigans for yrs, but didn't want a confrontation.

So not only does she admit to it, she tried to legitimize her actions with that excuse - UNBELIEVABLE! 

If you need tghe extra money - just raise the prices. It's not the money at all, but the fact that she's so damn blatant about it.
author: Rick P.

description: I love this place! The food is fabulous and the way they great you is so friendly and makes you feel good. It is a bit hard to hear them sometimes but that's not a big deal when their food is so good.
author: GIna K.

description: It was my first time in San Francisco, so naturally I had to get a burrito. Had some of my buddies take me to their favorite spot, and we ended up at Victors. My buddy suggested the pork chile verde burrito, and lemme tell us it was so fire. One of the best burritos I have ever had with question. A must stop next time in that city.
author: William M.

description:
I work right around the corner and have always been curious about this place. The lines are always long, so somethings got to be going right. I finally managed to slide in and give them a try. Right off the bat, you are greeted loudly by the wonderful lady behind the register. It's a great way to start the experience. I ordered a chorizo and eggs super burrito and was not disappointed. I'm quite particular about the ratio of the various ingredients in a burrito and I was quite pleased at the proportions. The pico was fresh and tasty.

I will definitely be going back and give  a try to the other items on the menu, in particular the tortas. And, I wouldn't mind being loudly welcomed every now and then.
author: Steve R.

description:
Very affordable, decent Mexican spot for SOMA. Line's a little slow but there's a sassy woman at the cash register telling you to "come on, lazy!" and giving you salsa even when you don't want it. All in good nature though, she was really friendly and loved my co-worker's chihuahua. 

* Carnitas dinner platter ($8-$9) - Rice a little soggy, you get your choice of everything (beans, sour cream guac, salsa, lettuce). Meat was pretty good, tender and hearty, just a tiny tiny bit dry. If you ever have a piece by itself, it's WAY over-salted, so always make sure to mix it with rice or whatever. They also fry some onions for you and heat up 3 soft taco shells. Pretty good deal.

Only about $6 for even a super burrito! Good deal.
author: Ziyan C.

description:
I love a casual Mexican food shop where I can get a burrito and go. The chicken had a really great grilled flavor, and the salsa was super fresh and flavorful.
I loved that the ladies working there kept calling me "mamacita". So much wonderful local happiness.
author: Megan P.

description:
This is my go-to lunch place in SOMA. Starting from Gracie greeting you at the door (Who doesn't like to be called beautiful, when they're about to down a massive burrito?) to the amazing food, you can't go wrong with Victor's!

My favorite items are the Chorizo & Egg burrito (Super, with guac), the flautas a la carte. The spicy salsa is delicious, so be sure to ask for an extra cup if you're to-go!
author: Steph M.

description: I've had 2 burritos in SOMA.  1 from Iron Cactus, and 1 from Victor's (both walking distance from my office in China Basin).  Iron cactus was whatever.  Victor's was much better, so the 4 stars could be based strictly on the fact that Iron Cactus was not so great.  But the Ladies at Victor's were so pleasant and friendly too!  I'll be coming back to get my burrito fix.  ~$8.50 for a super burrito + chips, and super quick service!
author: Matthew C.

description:
I've had better.

IThe staff is great! The ladies call every guy guapo! But that's the best part. I ordered a chilaquiles plate one morning, and I couldn't eat it. The chilaquiles were ok, but I felt the sauce needed more flavor and spice, and definitely salt. The rice had to have been microwaved from the night before, and was bland. Beans are hard to mess up, but they did ok there. Their burritos are whatevers as well, but for the price, one can do better!
author: Alan G.

description:
Nice Mexican, a bit confusing (in a good way), there is so much going on there and the woman working the counter is talking with basically everyone at the same time. I would recommend going here on a Thursday and try the chicken mole, they seem to have some special version only on Thursdays. It was very tasty.

There is a small outside area in the back that is much nicer to sit in, compared to the area in the front.
author: Magnus W.

description: Nice broad selection on the menu.  All the various meats are good.  The wet style burrito with sauce and cheese on top of your burrito is well worth the buck-fifty extra.  Lines can be long at lunch rush hour.  Extra seating in back patio is nice in the summer.
author: Lewis C.

description:
Solid Mexican food by the ballpark   ...and my office.

As everyone else says, if you hit lunch hour you'll get a loud welcome from the proprietor (guaaappooo or papicita).  You'll also get yelled at if you take too long to order or ask for the wrong thing.  I like that--Mexican food with the east-coast edge.

Burrito's are a little pricier than elsewhere in the city, but hey, if I wanted a cheap one, I could ride my bike over to the mission.

They taste pretty good and the hot salsa is nice and hot.
author: Rocco B.

description:
HOLA GUAPO!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

I'm giving this place 3 stars for the food and an extra star for the friendliness. I come here almost once a week since my work is so close to it. When you come in, the owner greets in a very joyous tone and so do all the ladies behind the counter. Everyone is referred to as 'guapo(a)' which I believe means handsome/beautiful. It's pretty funny and just makes you feel so welcome. All the food here is decently priced and taste wise is not bad. I've yet to have a bad experience. There are chips and salsa as you wait in line which is nice. If you are around the area then I recommend coming here at least once since the lady is soo nice. She's a hoot.
author: edward k.

description: good food, good price, nice patio, good salsa. very popular place and it's my go-to for mexican in the area
author: Cara D.

description: I'm currently working a job assignment two blocks down and was recommended to try this place. I was pleasantly surprised by the look/layout of the place;there is a nice back patio that you wouldn't ever guess existed from the street view (small entranceway). They've been in business since 1985 and it looks like they haven't changed a bit since then - I like that in a taqueria, keep it old school, nay on the polish, stream-lined look of a chain. Highly recommend their breakfast burritos; I got the mushroom and scrambled egg with salsa, beans, and rice and I loved it. Can't wait to try the rest of the menu.
author: Sean R.

description: Excellent.  I wasn't aware of a good burrito shop in this neighborhood...this isn't going to help with my burrito addiction "problem".
author: Michael G.

description: Had better carnitas burritos. Lack individual flavors or uniqueness. The chips are hard to bite on.
author: John C.

description: Best Mexican food in the area near my job, great customer service and great tasting food so authentic and perfectly seasoned to the taste. I can stand in there line any day its worth the wait, seriously.
author: M G.

description: The owner was very nice. Said they've been there for 31 one years. We had the chimichangas. Great vegetarian options. The food and salsa were excellent. Definitely will go back next time I'm in the City.
author: Sonya S.

description:
For your review of: Victor's

If you don't get why people go their and eat the same great food you must be a retard its good genius


In response to this comment from someone that doesn't even YELP:
Yeah, I am still not a fan (sorry), I really did try multiple times but it just doesn't do it for me.  Also, A+ vocabulary, especially using the word "retard".  Gold star for you.
author: Jacquelynne S.

description: My favorite place in SoMa. I would drive far out of my way for one of their breakfast burritos or just for the ambience of a real Mexican spot. I LOVE the women who work here. They can call my boyfriend guapo, papi, or whatever they want in those cute little accents.
author: Lauren R.

description:
Hola guapo!

This place is legit! Love their breakfast and lunch burritos. Owners and staff are really friendly, makes me want to come back again and again.

Only gripe is that it isnt open for dinner and on Sundays since I live right there and would probably eat every meal there if I could.
author: Aditya J.

description:
Customer Service: 5 stars, "Guapo!" They do a great job of making you feel special here. Even if everyone is a guapo or guapa. I think it's a nice little touch. 

Food: 3 stars, the burritos here are good. I like the shrimp burrito because they cook the shrimp right after you order it. 

Location: 4 stars, great location. Sadly, there are no better burrito options in the neighborhood.
author: Chris M.

description:
HOLA PAPITO! That's my greeting every single time I walk into Victor's. Those women are the sweetest. They have the best carnitas I've ever had, so be sure to order it in a Super Burrito. 

Chips while you wait, plenty of seating room and a great place to grab lunch.
author: Tyler H.

description: Love the Nopales (cactus) Breakfast burrito!!  So tasty and delicious. Great service and line moves fast!
author: Christine K.

description: Good food freshly made friendly helpful staff owner boss lady is a hoot love the carne Asda chips are great salsas are the bomb. I have been going here for 15 years and finally got on yelp to review
author: Mike J.

description:
Having lived in Mexico for a few years, I really miss having a good Pozole Soup as you don't often find it on menus in the US.

At Victor's they only make it on Fridays.  You get a large bowl of Red Pozole (Hominy Corn with Pork) and all the traditional condiments (onion, lime, radish, and oregano) for $7.

After asking to taste it, I knew the dish and broth was on point.  I was told that the cook was from the Mexican State of Michoacan.

I can't speak for the other items on the menu; but, I'll definitely be returning for the Pozole on Fridays.
author: Roy C.

description:
horrible service and burrito, 20 minute wait... And I didn't even get what I ordered. There was only one person in front of me, (who also didn't get his order)...wts

I really don't know what went wrong, and how it was so difficult to make our food. I ordered my bacon burrito, and just watched as all these burritos were being made wrong. She added things which myself and the person in front of me didn't want, while forgetting things which we had asked for. This wasn't happening all at once, I watched as she messed up his order, and it was my turn, and I was so fed up I just let her make what ever, I was expecting to get a burrito made I less than 5 min, and it literally took 20, and I was late already. 

Return? No thanks, I will take my business elsewhere.
author: Nye T.

description: Good burritos, great variety, friendly staff. Reasonable prices...and they're open for breakfast. What's not to like?
author: Dan K.

description:
This place should not be called Victor's, more like Guapa's! Unless Victor is hiding because he is too guapo to be seen. It's a small and authentic family run Mexican restaurant that has been in the same spot for almost 25 years now. You walk in and the first thing you hear is a very loud: "YELLOOW GUAPA(O)! How ju doin tuday?" 

I started to feel special that I was always called guapa and giggle to myself, but sometimes you see some really fugly people walk in, come on now, realistically, they are Fea(o), but no no no, everyone in victors is Guapa and Guapo forever. 

There are usually 2-3 cooks who are super quick and sound like nice parrots repeating guacamole guapa? Salsa guapa? Cheez Guapa? guapa, guapa, guapa, guapa...Yes, I would like a quesadilla with carne asada please. 

When it came time to pay, you see the owner with those old cash registers, that 70s hairdo, and all the religious candles and pictures behind her. "Alright, les see, guapa, ju wan dat for hir or tu go?" Me: "Me gustaria para llevar porfavor." She would say " GUAAAT, ju speak spanish! Where ju from?" And I said Nicaragua. She says: "Ohh wooow dat iz wonderful, ju want a coke? Me: "No, no". Her: It will be $8. As I pass her the debit card, she says "OH NO, minimum iz $10, get one sodaaaa!", me: oh then I will get a coke. Her: "oh goodness, dis machine no work, ok ok sign here guapa." Me: "Gracias!", Her: "Sankiu, have a very very good day"! 

Since then, I have had to take a Victor Vacation, but I do miss the quesadillas and the ladies. The tacos and burritos were alright, but I will definitely return sometime!
author: Stephanie M.

description:
We go here all the time because its right next to work. The lady in the front is great she makes me laugh every time. I always have a great time speaking with her, she usually sneaks me extra chips haha. Super burrito for the win! 

Seating is pretty nice in the back I would recommend it if you have time to sit and eat. There is usually a fairly long line around lunch time but the staff works very quickly and the will have you on your way asap.
author: Kevin K.

description: I had to get past the loud "hola guapo" when I entered which clearly all the other patrons were used to but after that I settled down and ordered a Fajita plate and two soft tacos. I agree with the other reviewers that said this is the best Mexican food south of  Market. It is small and I see why people don't mind the short wait. The food is excellent and the owner is really a "kick." Listen, this place makes great food, has terrific portions and they act like they really want your business. I will return soon!
author: Chocoolate I.

description:
Me and my staff are usually too busy to go out and get lunch, so we try to place our orders in as much as we can so we can just get to lunch and eat.

Today, we tired Victor's for the first time, and I loved it!

We called in to ask some questions about their food, and they were very busy, but the woman on the phone was still happy and very kind, even though she talked fast and hung up quickly.

When we called back to placed the order, she was still rushed, but she was no less kind or happy about it. Even though they were busy and I could tell, I did not feel rushed or pushed.

Best of all... the food was so GOOD! BEST mexican food I have had in SF! We WILL be back and it will be soon :)

Had to go back for a second round. The good was just as good today and the owner, Graciela, is really wonderful. She's even nicer in person than she was on the phone. I found my new lunch place in SF.
author: Maria S.

description: Amazing burrito. Best burrito I have ever had. Chicken mole was superb. And they sure were generous with the cheese which I love. I can't even start on how great the service is the girls behind the counter talked to me about the giants which was great. I had a super burrito and a Mexican coke for ten bucks which is a cheap lunch. Victors is my favorite burrito and the best burrito.
author: Ryland P.

description:
To the lady at the front: you had me at "guapa"

I love the lady at the front. Her quirky personality makes this place even more awesome!

For the past 3 months, all I heard about, was their amazing chicken tortilla soup. They only serve it once a week (I think). Sometimes when our cravings hit, we went there around 1pm, and they were all sold out. Today, we realllly wanted our chicken tortilla soup, so we called ahead of time and had them reserve our soup for us. :)

And oh boy. It was delicious! Some say that it's too spicy for them, but I felt like it was just right.
author: Sahana U.

description: I've been here a couple times now and haven't been impressed. It's the best Mexican food in the immediate area but not THAT good. I really didn't like the burrito I got here, and the enchiladas lacked flavor and were hard to eat. The price is to be expected for South of Market. The service is my real issue though, every time I've been there I've felt like I had to jump up and down for attention, even though I never go at busy times. They're always babbling amongst each other or other customers. I don't speak Spanish but I know enough to understand one of them saying "oh she doesn't speak Spanish" with a laugh, referring to me, which I didn't appreciate. I'd recommend this place with hesitation.
author: Allison M.

description:
Ready to be assaulted as you walk in the door with a hearty "Hola Guapa(o)?" Well, get ready. I've not walked in once without being greeted with extreme intensity. The lady working the cash drawer pumps personality into every square inch of air within that dig. 

The food ain't half bad either, a little pricier than I'd think for lunch time Mexican plates. Last time two chicken tacos and a soda cost me nearly $10, but it's super fresh, so good, always accompanied by chips and salsa, and freakin' delish. 

Try any of the chicken plates, and Pozole on Fridays. It's fantabulous. 

Always a line at lunch time, but it moves with some sense of urgency, if they don't the madam up front claps her hands and asks what the hold up is.
author: Kelly S.

description: Great authentic Mexican food with a very friendly staff.  They love the spice so be careful, it can burn. . . . twice.
author: Marc R.

description: Amazing place I ever went..... Love the burritos and of course everything... The cashier as the ability to make ur day more than happy...... And the ladies on the counter are the best... Their so friendly calling you guapo/guapa (Spanish) they made my day...
author: Jose G.

description:
Love this place! Gracie, the owner was so nice and welcoming, and I haven't had a better experience anywhere. She gave us free guac...and hugs on our way out! Plus they have a patio so you can eat "outside."

We all ordered bacon breakfast burritos. It's probably one of the most authentic breakfast burritos I've ever had in San Francisco. That's saying a lot because I've eaten a lot of breakfast (and regular) burritos having lived in San Diego. 

Thank you Gracie! We will definitely be back, can't wait to to try everything else!
author: Margaret L.

description:
Carnitas = YES.
Chili Verde = YES.
Al Pastor = not really.

This is a solid quick lunch spot around the corner from my office.  Super effecient, very nice staff.  The assembly line burritos are quite tasty although I'm not a big fan of the Al Pastor here.  They have simple rice/beans/salsa/guac/cheese to put in your burrito, but I'd also like some more veggie options.  I roll here about once a week for a lunch burrito fix.
author: Nicholas N.

description:
I know my own needs....Soft Corinthian Leather....
http://video.google.com/videoplay?docid=-57593845419909571
...OK OK, this has nothing to do with Victor's except I keep picturing the owner to look like Ricardo Montalban and telling his staff..."Smiles, everyone...smiles!" 

Next door to Primo Patio is this unassuming tacqueria run with alarming efficiency by two friendly women. I only came upon it because Jamie W. and I were looking for a quick bite before sitting in the Antarctic Circle that was AT&T last night when they showed a live performance of the SF Opera's "Samson and Delilah" on the jumbotron.

I saw one of the women grilling a sandwich and knew that was for me. The $5.60 Carne Asada Torta was a taste treat. Normally, the pull-away pork found in burritos and tacos was placed neatly between two sides of a grilled French roll. With fresh jalapenos and a slathering of salsa, it's like a barbecue pork sandwich without the heavy sauce. Gee I liked it a lot.

Otherwise nothing much to report here. The decor is standard formica lunchroom, and the restroom doesn't have a lock (so do make a lot of noise to avoid unseemly encounters). But the the seat cushion of the chair feels like...could it be soft Corinthian leather?

FOOD - 4 stars...no-frills torta was pretty yummy
AMBIANCE - 2.5 stars...roadside lunchroom vibe
SERVICE - 4 stars...fast with no fuss
TOTAL - 4 stars...not really a destination place but a bargain place to eat before the ballpark
author: Ed U.

description: Rather keep on walking and find a taco truck in SOMA somewhere.  The burritos are awful! They are nice people though.
author: Demanding T.

description:
Best Mexican food in SOMA. The owner who works the register greets everybody with an enthusiastic, "Hola Guapo, Hola Guapa!" Victor's is a quick service restaurant where you order at the counter. 

The food is extremely fresh, tasty, and authentic. Best of all, it's extremely cheap.
author: Steve V.

description: Agree with some of the other reviewers. Watch the cash register! The owner will distract you by yelling "guapo" while she slyly overcharges you.
author: Martin P.

description:
Having lived in southern california I guess I'm a little spoiled by awesome mexican food for cheap. This place is mediocre at best. They serve one of the wettest normal burritos that you'll find. I had to use three paper towels to clean up the drippings from the burrito. You'll probably also need to ask for extras when ordering your food as they tend to be rather skimpy. The chips always end up going in the compost as this place uses thick tortillas which are hard and inedible once cold.
Best thing bout the place is the lady running the register yelling "hola guapo"
author: Eric N.

description:
The burritos are good, but I'm giving my overall rating based on value, atmosphere (nice to be called guapo 14 times in 3 minutes).

If you want some affordable quick mexican that's pretty good - I'd recommend this spot.
author: Jeff F.

description: Hola Mama!  Gracie is always welcoming no matter how crowded it is.  Wonderful food, fit for meat eaters and vegans alike (my husband loves the cactus burrito and I love the carnitas).  You can never go wrong with the food and the constantly upbeat atmosphere.  Good prices, and it's worth going out of your way for.
author: Maureen P.

description:
I come here pretty often with my brother for lunch since it's close to work, but I wouldn't say it's the best mexican food restaurant ever. It's a cute little place with a nice owner who always strikes up random topic conversations with us (seriously, she talks about the most randomest things ever). She's the one who's always greeting everyone at the door with a "Hey Guapo(a)!" and giving you extra chips with your order. Not that you can't get enough of it already since they usually have a sombrero of chips and dip on the counter to munch on while you wait. The food is pretty decent and reasonably priced. The salsa they have out on the tables really helps flavor the food because i find that the food tastes pretty bland without it.  

My favorite is the chilorio (shredded pork) chimichanga super with jalapeños. I usually get it without the beans so they fill it up more with the pork and rice. oh and they toast it so it's nice and crunchy on the outside while soft and juicy on the inside. yum! when you order anything "super", your order comes topped with sour cream, salsa and guacamole. and if you get your order to-go, don't forget to ask for extra salsa. it's good and adds some kick to the food. :D
author: Christine P.

description:
Have you ever eaten at Victors when there is some event at the Moscone Center using Hispanic workers (who don't speak much English)? There are a ton of inexpensive places to get a quick bite. Somehow they know to migrate all the way down to 3rd and Townsend to eat. That alone speaks volumes to its authenticity to down home Mexican food.

No one is saying Victors is upscale, gourmet or hip . If you want frills and interesting options, go up a few blocks to Chevy's. Though it is not on the menu, ask for grilled veggies next time on your veggie tacos. They will grill up some mushrooms, green peppers, onion and tomato and add it to your tacos. It costs a bit more, but worth it. Victor's is solid, no frills comforting Mexican fare I have missed since moving to the bay area.
author: Ginger K.

description: Good Mexican food, friendly staff, fast, price is good/ok. Great spot to grab a burrito on the go. I buy the Mexican Salad which is really good. The salsa drives the flavor in the food.
author: Kyle J.

description:
HOLLA GUAPO!!!

Hands down, cannot beat the service.  She is ridiculously friendly and is always willing to strike up a conversation about anything.  A very good time to practice my broken spanish.

Super Chile Relleno Burrito on a spinach tortilla pleasseeeee.  You know she likes you when she gives you extra chips.  I ALWAYS get extra chips :)

You can sit outside in the patio and enjoy the wonderful day while dousing your burrito in their homemade hot sauce. 

And don't forget to snack on the chips while in line to whet your appetite!
author: Paran Y.

description: Best Mexican in the Area, eat up and enjoy lots farting later.
author: Mack T.

description: Great Mexican food for a reasonable price. The staff was super friendly and really informative. I wasn't sure what I wanted and they gave me some suggestions and they were great choices. I will be coming back for sure.
author: Jeffery H.

description:
Hola! 
creo que soy lo suficientemente inteligente como para escribir esto..
I used to really really like big, turgid, tubes of meat.  It used to really turn me on.  The reason why I liked burritos over gyros and other middle eastern alternatives is because of the turgid factor.  Heh.  Turgid.  Burritos are turgid and moist.  

I've now become a bit more sophisticated.  I like burritos because of their turgid-ness.  And I also like quesadilla super suiza carne asada!  Power up.  Although the format of the quasadilla is floppy, there is some extra skin here and there, especially at the business end, it is super moist.  The tortilla is grilled on that awesome grill which I hope has never been washed.  

And I hate beans.  I just don't like it.  Is that unamerican of me?  I don't like beans and I don't like peanut butter.  Some days the legume can be more tolerable, which is why I still pledge undying love to the burrito.  But now I have a vibrational alternative that has no beans: quesadilla super suiza carne asada, power up!

I love the salsa here.  There is only 3 kinda, but it gets the trick done.  Today, it was a little watery.  I like to mix the salsa fresca with the deep red one.  It has that burn and scalp tingle, sometimes mistaken for indigestion.  But it's the peppers.  

Today, I saw a not-homeless looking woman come in here, fill a drinking cup full of the pickled jalapenos, cover the cup with a napkin and walk out of here as proud as Mary Poppins.  Without buying anything else.  As Pretty Woman would have said, Snack?

The bottom line here...... weather you like beans or not......  Eat at VICTORS!
author: Yelp-a-holi C.

description:
My people!

I am Mexican. I know real Mexican when I eat it. Whether it comes from Oaxaca, Chiapas, Sonora, Tijuana, Aguascalientes, Rosarito, D.F., San Diego (yes), from the east to the west - I know Mexican!

This.is.real.Mexican.

If you don't like it, go away! Nobody cares! This is real Mexican and for those of you craving a real Mexican meal served by real Mexicans with that oh-so-real authentic taste that your grandma used to cook and your mom never mastered. This is Mexican.

Now - rant of authenticity aside. This is not a restaurant, it's more like a to-go side restaurant with real Mexican to go. 

My favorites:

- Carnitas tostada
- Carne asada tacos con cilantro y cebolla (like the street vendors do)

Staples of authenticity: Tortilla soup, sopes, and Milanesa. I had their Milanesa two years ago when I first discovered them, it was the first thing I ordered from them. I remember being content.
 (Side note: This was on a wonderful sunny SF morning after my car was broken into and I took my car to the then-body shop now-turned parking lot on Ritch & townsend, of which I am a happy patron!)

I love Victor's, I look forward to their weekly meal. A good taco, burrito (for you guerro's), some chips, and an enthusiastic "HOLA GUAPO!" - Victor's gets my hearty vote (and lunch money).
author: Roxy G.

description: In my opinion, this is the best Mexican joint in the area. It's not Mission, but it's pretty solid. Steak super burrito is good, salsa is good. One of the employees gives a great "Hola Guapo (or Guapa)" to you when you enter, which brightens your afternoon!
author: Thuan N.

description:
Also known as "Guapo's" around our office.

Many of the other reviews have it down pat.  Above average burritos in taste, but not in size.  Not as good or as cheap as the Mission places, but then again, you go in expecting that.
Pastor and carnitas are, IMO, the two best burritos here.

Decent chips, but you usually don't get free salsa unless you're a regular.  Their "hot" salsa is pretty darn hot, especially compared to the mild.

Many people have not noticed that in addition to the few tables in the front, there is a backyard patio, which is really nice on sunny days like we had today.

4 stars considering it's the best we've got in this area, but I'd give it 3.5 if I could.
author: dan s.

description:
We went on a Saturday at noon, and the place had just been bum rushed by a construction crew. The two ladies working could barely keep up. The place was a little on the dirty side and there was an abundance of Giants regalia throughout. 

The super burrito was good, but only because it was Pearly Cactus, and a cactus burrito is hard to come by. Consider it a novelty factor. The salsa was moderately fresh, but the chicken quesadadillas were weak.
author: Wes T.

description: Tuesday's Tortilla soup is the best tortilla soup I have ever had... EVER.  Just going in there is a trip, check it out and see how you get greeted walking in.  It's a riot!  Everyone is super friendly and everything they make is nothing less than delicious.  I'm telling you... Tortilla Soup Tuesday is the only way to go if you are in the area - but get there before 1pm because it is that good, they will sell out.
author: Marisa-Lee C.

description: This place is fairly good but nothing stands out. It seemed a bit bland and boring when I went and the service is pretty slow. I was hungover so maybe I was just out of it, but the food was just average. The prices and location were nice though and they do have chips and salsa just chillin on the counter. It kind of seems like it would be riddled with bacteria after so many gross people touching it and stuff.
author: Gus S.

description:
Friendly staff but considering how many comments "The Lady" gets in Yelp reviews, I expected something more than what I got. No floor show. No hilarity. She's a character, to be sure, but is San Francisco so lacking in characters that this one deserves so much notice? 

The tacos were A-OK, hence the three stars.
author: Will R.

description: This has been one of my favorite lunch spot for almost 5 years (while working in SOMA). Great to sit outside in the little courtyard at the back, eat chips with salsa while you wait in line to place your order and chat with the owner.
author: Stéphanie S.

description:
Really tempted to give 'em 5 stars but in a city full of burrito joints, they're damn good but not the best in town. 

The upsides are numerous. They do breakfast. There's a kickass patio out back which is great for fine weather. They greet you warmly. The food is tasty and their salsas are excellent. 

I usually get a burrito of some sort and they're dependably good and reasonably priced, as are the tortas. They're pretty efficient too, so don't let a long line scare you away. 

In an area full of good, moderately priced lunch locations, this is one of my go-to spots.
author: Rob G.

description:
This is the only authentic mex place in the neighborhood, so props for that.

I go here almost exclusively for the soup, so that's what my review is based on. The chicken tortilla and pork pozole soup specials are both fantastic, especially with all the toppings (ripe avocado, cilantro, cabbage, fresh jalapenos, tortillas, onions, etc). They are brothy the way they should be. Pro tip: always ask for the pickled jalapenos and carrots in yo soup! 

I am not a big fan of their style of guacamole - it has a blended texture (as opposed to mashed) and it usually tastes like there were some unripe avo's in there. 

The whole staff is really friendly. Love going there and love the unpretentious atmosphere with pots of salsa on every table.

$7.50 minimum credit card order.
author: Emily S.

description:
Amazing Mexican food......I had Nopalitos con huevo (cactus w/egg) tacos for breaksfast and they were amazing!!!

Great food for not too much money. They have all the Mexican essentials.....

Enjoy!!!
author: Lupe D.

description: Continuing in my journey to eat at every restaurant in SoMa, Victor's was definitely a delight. From the boisterous greeting of the woman behind the counter to the friendly service and delicious food, Victor's did not disappoint. Very reasonably priced, at least as far as this area goes. Overall, I was pretty happy. The wet-style super burrito was just what I needed! Great fresh meats and salsas too!
author: Lance H.

description:
Oh hello Victor's whose meat used to make my friend sick and whose vegetarian burrito was as bland as chalk; you have another very welcome option! 

It is not on the menu, but if you ask for a vegetarian burrito "with vegetables" they will cook them up right there for you.  For realz, on a grill and everything!  It has been awhile since I have been to a Mexican joint that actually grills the veggies on request. But, you have to say it RIGHT AWAY, because it takes them an extra couple of minutes to make it and if we don't follow the rules and keep it easy for them, we are going to see our would-be-grilled-veggies under a hot lamp... Know what I am sayin'?  

I was so happy to have onions, peppers and mushrooms delight my senses today, and may I say again, it is most welcome.
author: Hayley W.

description: Love this place. they are fun, food is great, and above all else, they are very friendly! Everyone walking is is greeted Hola Guapo and Guapa!(Forgive if I spell wrong on those words) and the same as you leave you are greeted and thanked. If you walk by and see it full in the seating area, or a long line don't fret, yes the line goes out the door and the seating gets full but the line moves very quickly even when out the door you will be done in under 10 minutes with food in hand and there is actually a patio in the back with a ton of seating so almost always plenty of room to sit and enjoy your food.
author: Wil A.

description:
There are some things you can fake easily... good mexican can't be done. I'd rather have turkey bacon for the rest of my life than eat fake-axican..such as a place down the street from Victors that I have previously reviewed (:

Las chicas from Victors are amazing, but charm gets you no where with me in regards to lunch. I knew something was special about this place... and one thing the state of Michocan is famous for is, woman who can cook (ie;..ahem myself). I didn't take the easy test of this place and play a safe card of a chicken burrito or quesadilla. I went straight to the gut. First I tried the Torta de Milanesa, asked for jalepenos and queso fresco..and yep, just like the best ones I've had in TJ and Mex... heart won. THEN, I was fighting a cold and tried their Posole, no tough feat but they have mastered that too. 

I would pass on all the lame carne asada stuff and go for the tasty treats you can't always get at La Taqueria or Pancho Villa.. (the only other places worthy of 3-4 stars in the city).

so.. felicidades muchachas!! they have won my Mexican food seeking heart.
author: Gen O.

description: Hola Guapa!! As soon as you enter the owner make sure to let you feel welcome and notice. Service was decent but I feel like the salsa wasn't really that good, I usually prefer the salsa to be a little more textured then all mushy. Chips are little bit too thick for my taste and the burrito is just average.
author: Johnny Y.

description:
Decent Mexican food in SOMA.

Quick lunch, lots of options, decent burrito.  The meat is not the highest quality, but it's not bad.  The staff is friendly.  And I always get Coca Cola Mexico :)
author: Ben B.

description:
Hola Guapo!

I eat here all the time cuz I work a block away. It ain't El Farolito, but it's pretty darn good food and mama takes care of her customers like family. Give it a shot, you'll probably end up with a smile on your face and a very full belly. My favs: The burritos (breakfast or regular). Both are huge and tasty!
author: Bill F.

description:
I once was blind but now I see. 

Seriously, what was I thinking? (maybe I was in denial since I'm such a huge Mexican food lover and this was the only place within walking distance to work). Having worked 2 blocks from this place for over 4 years I feel I've given this place plenty of chances to impress me. No such luck.

Their very questionable meat has made me sick more times that I care to think about and though they have very friendly service and great outdoor seating I will no longer be eating at Victors. So sad...can we please get a decent Mexican place in this area....please!!
author: Kristy M.

description:
Best Super Tacos I have had in awhile. 

I work around the ballpark, and Victor's is one of two spots that you can consider me a regular at.  (the other being HRD)
author: Joe E.

description:
hi mama.  hi papa.  hi mamacita.  hola papi.  how are you today?

even though the burritos are not as good as what you'd find in the mission (home sweet home), the greeting when you walk in the door might be enough reason to go to victor's.  the main woman (maybe she owns the joint) is usually the one hollering hello to you ask you walk in but all of the employees here will refer to you as papa / mama / guapo / guapa / mamacita / etc.

the burritos are decent.  and that's all i've ever had.  the size of the burrito is pretty good for how much you're paying... but, i think a burrito + chips + a tamarind soda for just over $10 feels like a titch too much.  but i'll still get burritos here if i'm super jonesin' for one during the workday.
author: Lauren P.

description:
Oh man, do I love a Victor's Burrito when I know I'm going to need some real food to get me through a challenging day. Veggie super with black beans is my usual order, and the blends of flavors and spices are perfect.  Did I mention their spicy salsa is to die for?  

The woman running the register is like a hilarious Auntie you never had, accosting everyone as "guapa/o"  and shouting things like "mild salsa is for wimps!"  

I think if they had homemade guacamole that wasn't so runny, I'd give them five stars.
author: Emily P.

description: I really, really liked this place! Great burritos custom made. So good!!great counter staff who say all their customers are good looking (Hey Guapa!).
author: Junie M.

description: Great service and kick ass breakfast burritos.
author: Sn K.

description:
PROs:
